title: Equivalent resistance - current in R1 R2 R3 combo

content.question: A circuit consists of a battery with a potential difference of <math alttext="delta V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></math> and three resistors with resistances <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, as shown in the figure. What is the current in the resistor of resistance <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator delta V, and denominator R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator delta V, and denominator R sub 1, end sub, plus R sub 2, end sub, plus R sub 3, end sub, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="delta V, times open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over R sub 1, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over R sub 2, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over R sub 3, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="delta V, times open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator R sub 2, end sub, plus R sub 3, end sub, and denominator R sub 1, end sub, times R sub 2, end sub, plus R sub 2, end sub, times R sub 3, end sub, plus R sub 1, end sub, times R sub 3, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta V, times open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator R sub 2, end sub, plus R sub 3, end sub, and denominator R sub 1, end sub, times R sub 2, end sub, plus R sub 2, end sub, times R sub 3, end sub, plus R sub 1, end sub, times R sub 3, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
